intro: Phelipanche angustilaciniata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that produces striking blue or purple flowers, typically blooming in the morning. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in sunny environments. Botanically, it belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, known for its twining vines and showy flowers.
